intro: Cerradicola bullata, commonly known as the Bullate Cerradica, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, oval-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
